triples.name: Signalling theory
triples.relevance: The central theoretical framework examined throughout the review of how signals convey credible information about unobservable qualities.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: The paper examines decision-making under incomplete information and how signals help improve decisions in organizational contexts.

triples.name: Communication
triples.relevance: Signaling theory is fundamentally about communication between signalers and decision-makers to convey information.

triples.name: Information asymmetry
triples.relevance: The paper addresses how signals resolve information asymmetries when decision-makers have incomplete or imperfect information.

triples.name: Organizational behavior
triples.relevance: The paper reviews management studies examining signaling theory applications to understand behavior within and among organizations.
